summary: clean up extension points in plugin configuration
description: currently all plugins that contain child plugins should explicitly call addextensionpoint(string name for each child plugin
as a convenience renderservice now checks for the existence of a property wicket.extensions and if it exists it will call addextensionpoint

this means that all explicit calls to addextensionpoint can be removed and added to the configuration of course also it is important to make it easy to distinguish between extension point configuration properties and normal plugin-specific configuration properties
this can be done by using a simple naming convention all extensionpoints start with extension

summary: refactoring and portal integration
description: goals written by ate douma redesign hst domain and sitemap configuration replace regex based mapping with hierarchy based configurations replace embedded configurations with node references making them reusable replace elnode wrapping of hst configurations with pojo objects interface based disconnected split hst into separate components to support usage as required for a portal split hst into and artifacts reusable/optional module components should be split of in separate client module artifacts core features like jcr session management caching searching etc

needs to be managed in the but usable different classloader from the portlets all interfaces need to be moved to the artifacts no behavior implementation is allowed in the not even logging initialization/configuration everthing passed between and needs to be interface or plain generic pojo class driven separate mounting and rewriting as pluggable components to support requirements in a portal rewriting and sitemap mounting needs to be pluggable no direct dependencies on servlet api or web.xml configurations filter for initializing hst requests redesign and module configuration and management replace jsp pulled layout rendering and module invocations by repository driven pushed configuration define a hst module as a module interface based class configured in the repository with a render time only jsp to be invoked by hst as additional but required configuration define items also as layout type modules use a structure compatible with portal psml page fragment configuration but do not yet provide additional psml features like positioning decorations theming etc

future goal design and implement action execute and state handling managed by hst separate execute from render processing including state/parameter passing between these provide module parameter namespace handling nice url handling potential issue nice url management also and even more so problematic for a portal design and implement portlet wrapping of a module and coordination with centralized hst core management integrate portal url mapping with mounting and rewriting potential issues state sharing between modules jcr classloader management redesign and implement hst template tags and module usage downgrade template tags to render time usage and functionality only design template tag with module coordination parameter definitions provide new light elnode wrapping for usage within jsp no pojo mapping for common repository node types yet like document blog calendar item etc

summary: simplify cluster controls

this would be done by the same plugin that receives the reference to the iplugincontrol
the iplugincontrol should still be registered as a service allowing plugins to register additional interfaces for lifecycle management

this account for about of the time
then in propertyfieldplugin a lot of time is used in the updateprovider from fieldplugin in updateprovider field takes about ms per string field and the takes about ms per string field

summary: changelog's for virtual states are not updated between sessions after a save in a specific session
description: it also influences frontend sites the problem is that if some logged in session has traversed some virtual structure this virtual structure is not discarded when an other session saves

so for example when in the frontend site we have some navigation which is a result of virtual node structure and another sessions changes the name of one of the nav items and saves this change be visible in the frontend the virtual state of the changelog for that session is not influenced

before the code in the hippolism made use of i think this was to inform other changelogs through the dispatcher.notifystatediscarded(local which is called from but it is very well possible that the session that changed the physical node did not have the same virtual nodestate loaded so would not discard it anyway
afaics the only way possible to fix this is to destroy all virtual states from all changelogs after any save from any user
clearly this results in a lot of reloading of virtual states but the physical states are still in cache so will be fast
also i think it might involve some concurreny issues because another session might just be building up some virtual node structure when the delete all gets called
furthermore obviously saving involves quite some updating of all changelogs

therefor i would like to suggest to minimize automatic save actions from the cms and i think will be very important use session pooling for frontend application for the anonymous user to reduce the number of concurrent session everyone browsing the frontend now gets a new jcr session iiuc

summary: reformatting and import of foreign code
description: the commit tag is to be used whenever foreign code is imported into the repository source base if code reformatting is an issue

the rules for this are as follows when new outside code is brought into the repository source base it should first be checked in as original unmodified code with in the commit message this issue as tag then perform code formatting and recommit the sources without any other additional changes other than the reformatting

again use this issue for the commit tag if an breaks because these two checkins do not allow reformatting than that is okay optionally autobuild could be turned off for commits with this tag when existing code is reformatting because for some reason it was not formatted the way intended perform the right code formatting and commit these changes to the svn repository as single change using this tag as commit message
this means that no other changes other than reformatting are allowed for such a commit
